body:
✨Startup tips✨

It's better to:
Ship early and fix embarrassing bugs
 
Than:
Build features nobody wants 🙂

Hope you enjoyed the story! 

✅ If you enjoyed, please share. Retweet from the first tweet so it can be found. 

✅ Follow me @EvergreenMEP where I ✍️ daily actionable tips, insights and personal experiences on #StartUps and the #FoundersJourney.

Startup Sales Tip: 

When selling to executives, the more technical your speak, the more you'll be delegated to a junior contact.

Avoid jargon and stay strategic.

With everything that is going on? — How is everyone upping their cybersecurity protocols? 

What are the best tips/resources for startups who don't have a lot of resources?

Thinking of writing a simple, easy-to-follow guide to help stressed-out marketing managers at startups learn to write better copy in half the time. 

You’d learn:

- user centered writing
- how to structure for conversion
- actual writing tips to make it better

Interested?

Random tips for startup founders...

Be consistent with everything.

View problems as fun challenges.

Make progress daily that compounds.

Embrace and learn from failure.

Don't overthink small details.

When in doubt, ship it.

Believe in yourself when others don't.

First board meeting this year 

Starts in 7 min 

First one since closing on $3.5M convertible note 

First time with board observers 

Anyone have a list of best practices?

It’s too late for today — but what are your best tips for running a tight startup board meeting?

@garyvee Gary! I love you man! Anyways I’m currently working for a startup company in the internet 3.0 space. Unfortunately I’m not making any money yet and I gotta support my girl so I’m working for 8-8 at the startup and 8-12 doordashing to make ends meet! Any tips to stay motivated?

Startups are high performance machines that should focused on quality and efficiency. At @eightsleep we call it “Operational Excellence”. Here are 8 practical tips, some from @rabois, some from Frank Slootman and others from High Output Management👇

Want to make $100/hr+ with a sweaty startup idea?

Wife & I ordered an in cabin couples massage (set up in the living room)

Asked them how many they do per day? They said 2-7 per day.

They charge $225/hr (plus tips) for the hour long massage

Math time.....👇

Startup tip:

Don’t take money from people you wouldn't hire.

Don’t invest in companies you wouldn't work for.

A Few Tips For Startups That Work

- Be passionate and enjoy the ride.

- Concentrate on creating value, not exit strategy.

- Manage your cash with financial discipline.

- Build a board who actually solve problems.

Tip for startups:

Value your community as much as your product.

I realize that public radio probably needs to take whatever sponsors they get but @Marketplace airing sponsorship adverts from a crypto IRA startup is at least questionable, bordering on financial malpractice.

Pro tip: Don't put your retirement in crypto...

cc @kairyssdal

Planning on spending a weekend in Austin TX sometime in the next 1-2 months! I’ve never been, but have always wanted to visit-- plus at this point it feels like a tech startup founder’s rite of passage 😂

I know I have lots of ATX Twitter friends. Any tips for things to do/see?

SEO tip for SaaS startups:

Create pages targeting
1) <competitor> alternatives
2) <competitor> vs <your product>

Even if keywords are low volume, conversions are high!

Pro-tip:
Get listed on already ranking pages (eg. Product Hunt) as an alternative to your competitor.

Startup tips: Do your research

You might learn that the problem you wanted to solve isn’t really a problem. You might learn that your intended audience isn’t the right audience.

The war for talent in startups is fierce right now. 

Here's are 5 tips to maximise your salary during an interview process 👇
Startup tip: don't overthink. Speed of execution is what makes a difference.

"Trust is the biggest risk to technology and user experience is the key." @coinbase wasn't the first wallet, but they were the first wallet someone's mom would feel comfortable using.

Do you have any tips for fellow startups?

Two weeks after joining Twitter, my feed consists of: 

* Startup and investing discussions 
* Product management tips 
* Church politics discussions 
* Web3, Crypto
* Wordle, a lot of wordle

Most of it seems to be stuff people I follow have liked. As expected?
Pro tip, do not be that person asking people to sign an NDA before you talk to them about your startup idea

Career update:
I have re-joined @reuters as India tech correspondent, based in Delhi.

Tracking big tech to startups to telecoms, bracing for a wild journey ahead alongside the incredible @adityakalra and bossman @kenli729. Wish me luck!

Tips > munsif.vengattil at tr dot com

The tip of the spear of technological innovation rests within VC-backed startups

To stay up to speed with our adversaries, the DoD now has an adoption problem, not an innovation problem

The DoD needs to adopt technologies rather than write specs

Bet on teams like a VC not RFPs

All that matters for a startup is finding a good product market fit.

Some startups take years to find it, some use few months and some never find it.

There is really know definite rules to finding it but here is a guide that can help.

A thread 👇
#startuptips

What is the best way to demonstrate your product without loosing the audience? 

I’ve done around 500 software demos during the past 5 years with 80% win rate.

These are the tips I share with #startup founders I meet. 

Thread 👇 1/14
Top tip: if you want to hear all sorts of confidential shit about Valley startups and other things, hang out at the communal table at The Mill on Divis.

Marketing tip:

Your enemy as a startup founders is noise.

You’ll add features.
You’ll talk to your users.
You’ll check out competitors.

The key ingredient? Stick to a simple narrative your users will recognize. 

Always choose clarity over clutter.

Thinking of starting a YT show— about introverts in the startup industry, successful public speakers, and socially shy people who managed to build an audience without draining themselves. 

We'll share our systems, tips, and frameworks. 

Might it be helpful?

Startup tip: make yourself replaceable 

Hire people who can do the work you're doing now. 

If you had to disappear for a few days it should be business as usual

If u hve pitched @Mashinsky you know how difficult it is 🥶 #startup #VentureCapital #founders share tips below👇

Webinars help you sell at scale. Here’s some tips…

1. Invite potential customers
2. Storytell why your startup exists
3. Discuss market pain points
4. How your solution helps
5. Goal is to educate not sell
6. Q&A and call to action

Do this every month and watch revenue go up.

There are so many opportunities in the development/social impact sector. Unlike LinkedIn where the opportunity flies, there's not so much info here

You can make 6/7 figures working for Nonprofits/NGOs/Startups etc.

50 likes, and my page will focus on sharing opps, tips etc
Startup pro tip: be forgiving to your team, but make it a hard rule to check your ego at the door, and enforce this rule with an iron fist.  That includes you as well. No egos at work!

I have to learn many things during the course of this project and hopefully develop it into a startup
Wish me all the best folks
#startupindia

Startup tip: There is no blueprint

Everyone loves rags-to-riches stories, hoping for that one insight that made all the difference. 

It’s the work that makes all the difference. 

If you love the work, you’ll find a way.
